column2: In the case of Mariam Beebee v. Seyed Mohamed (supra) Sansoni C. J.
delivering  the  majority  decision  of  the  Divisional  Bench  that  heard  this
case said as follows at page 38:
independent of and distinct from the appellate jurisdiction of this Court.
Its object is the due administration of justice and the correction of errors,
sometimes committed by the Court itself, in order to avoid miscarriages
of  justice.  It  is  exercised  in  some  cases  by  a  Judge  of  his  own  motion,
when an aggrieved person who may not be a party to the action brings
to  his  notice  the  fact  that,  unless  the  power  is  exercised,  injustice  will
result.  The  Partition  Act  has  not,  I  conceive,  made  any  changes  in  this
